Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Borderline fasting blood glucose level; Hearing loss
Marginally raised cholesterol; High uric acid levels
High BMI and waist circumference; High hsCRP
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Bilateral high frequency moderate hearing loss - please have a full audiology assessment done

Overview Notes: High CRP indicates increased inflammation in the body - try to eat a health anti-inflammatory diet, lose weight, manage your stress and continue supplementing with omega 3. Consider adding a curcumin supplement.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None

Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Bilateral high frequency hearing loss
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Overview Notes: High CRP indicates increased inflammation in the body - try to eat a health anti-inflammatory diet, lose weight, manage your stress and continue supplementing with omega 3. Consider adding a curcumin supplement.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Report Date: 2022-01-18

Women's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Your cholesterol remains marginally raised but is better than last year so that is good. Red meat can increase uric acid so please watch how much red meat is in your diet.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Comment Value: Ebrahim it was a pleasure to do your medical today. We wish you a happy and healthy 2022!

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Frequent exercise
Quit smoking; Doesnt drink
Blood glucose, cholesterol levels and vitamin d levels better than last year
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: Ebrahim it was a pleasure to do your medical today. Its great to see an improvement in some of the parameters since last year so I encourage you to keep moving in the right direction, paying particular attention to trying to lose some weight, eating a healthy diet, managing your blood sugar levels, exercise and stress management. We wish you a happy and healthy 2022!

Report Date: 2022-01-18
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates increased inflammation in the body - try to eat a health anti-inflammatory diet, lose weight, manage your stress and continue supplementing with omega 3. Consider adding a curcumin supplement.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: Ebrahim it was a pleasure to do your medical today. Its great to see an improvement in some of the parameters since last year so I encourage you to keep moving in the right direction, paying particular attention to trying to lose some weight, eating a healthy diet, managing your blood sugar levels, exercise and stress management. We wish you a happy and healthy 2022!

Comment Value: Well done for keeping up with your yearly screening.  This with healthy lifestyle choices will help reduce your risk for developing familial related chronic illnesses.
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Overview Notes: High CRP indicates increased inflammation in the body - try to eat a health anti-inflammatory diet, lose weight, manage your stress and continue supplementing with omega 3. Consider adding a curcumin supplement.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Frequent exercise
Quit smoking; Doesnt drink
Blood glucose, cholesterol levels and vitamin d levels better than last year
Comment Key: ReportNote

Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Report Date: 2022-01-18
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.

Overview Notes: Keep an eye on your blood sugar levels given your family history. The level is on the upper range of normal. Watch the carbs and sugar in your diet, try to lose some abdominal weight and continue exercising.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Women's Health Recommendations:

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Borderline fasting blood glucose level; Hearing loss
Marginally raised cholesterol; High uric acid levels
High BMI and waist circumference; High hsCRP
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related

Overview Notes: Frequent exercise
Quit smoking; Doesnt drink

Overview Notes: Weight around your abdomen puts you at a higher risk for cardiovascular disease and diabetes. Continue to watch your diet and exercise and try to lose some weight.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low DHEA - probably stress related
